Auto-Slides is a system that automatically generates presentation slides from academic research papers. It uses a multi-agent framework and large language models to extract content, plan the presentation, and optimize for pedagogical effectiveness, offering interactive customization and multimodal output.

The repository provides Catppuccin-themed icons for file explorers on various web-based platforms like GitHub, GitLab, Gitea, Forgejo, Bitbucket, and Tangled. It is implemented as a browser extension available on Chrome, Firefox, and Edge, enhancing the visual appeal of these platforms with soothing pastel icons.

OpenTagViewer is an Android application that allows users to track Apple AirTags on their Android devices. It leverages the FindMy.py library to retrieve location data and provides a user interface for viewing current and historical locations of AirTags, a feature not natively available on iOS.
